title: Commending Brittany Roan upon the occasion of being named Student of the Year by the New York Association for Continuing/Community Education
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commending  Brittany  Roan upon the occasion of
being named Student  of  the  Year  by  the  New  York  Association  for
Continuing/Community Education

WHEREAS,  It  is  the sense of this Legislative Body to take note of and
publicly  acknowledge  individuals  who  have  distinguished  themselves
through their exemplary pursuit of education as adults; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly  proud  to  commend
Brittany  Roan  upon  the occasion of being named Student of the Year by
the New York Association for Continuing/Community Education, at its 28th
Annual Student Awards and Legislative Event on March 8-9, 2011, in Alba-
ny, New York; and
  WHEREAS, Brittany Roan understands better than  anyone  the  value  of
education  and  the  challenges  and obstacles that are faced by some in
trying to obtain that education, particularly as an adult; and
  WHEREAS, The oldest  of  11  siblings,  Brittany  Roan  acquired  many
responsibilities  at  a  young  age; she was responsible for helping her
mother with  the  household  chores  and  taking  care  of  her  younger
siblings; and
  WHEREAS,  Brittany Roan and her siblings began home schooling once she
completed sixth grade; after undergoing some difficult times, Brittany's
family became homeless for approximately two years and, as a result, she
fell behind in her studies; and
  WHEREAS, At age 16, armed with an indomitable  spirit,  Brittany  Roan
decided  she  wanted  to obtain her General Education Diploma (GED); she
enrolled  at  Monroe  Community  College's  GED  S.T.A.G.E  Program  and
received her GED at the age of 18; and
  WHEREAS, In the Spring of 2008, Brittany Roan enrolled as a student at
Monroe  Community  College  to  pursue an Associate's degree in Business
Administration; and
  WHEREAS, In addition to pursuing her Associate's degree, Brittany Roan
decided to enroll at the Rochester Educational Opportunity Center  full-
time in the Medical Secretary Certificate Program; during this time, she
completed a medical secretary internship at the Monroe County Department
of Health; and
  WHEREAS,  The Monroe County Department of Health was so impressed with
her abilities, professionalism, and strong work ethic  that  they  hired
her  as  a full-time Receptionist/Clerk II after only the second week of
her internship; and
  WHEREAS, Brittany Roan graduated from Rochester  Educational  Opportu-
nity  Center in the Spring of 2010 with high honors while simultaneously
continuing her studies at Monroe  Community  College  full-time  in  the
evenings and working part-time; and
  WHEREAS,  In June of 2010, Brittany Roan began working for the Depart-
ment of Health as a full-time employee; today she maintains  this  posi-
tion  while continuing her studies at Monroe Community College where she
anticipates finishing her Associate's degree in May of 2011; and
  WHEREAS, After graduating from Monroe Community College, Brittany Roan
aspires to continue her education by obtaining a  Bachelor's  degree  in
Business  Administration  while  majoring  in  Marketing and minoring in
Accounting; and
  WHEREAS, In addition to her many educational objectives, Brittany Roan
plans to begin volunteering for the  National  Center  for  Missing  and
Exploited Children; and

  WHEREAS,  Brittany  Roan  has  been a beacon of light and hope for her
family; through her actions, she has inspired her mother, who  plans  on
returning to school to earn her GED; and
  WHEREAS,  A  talented and driven young woman, Brittany Roan has demon-
strated integrity and honor while using Adult Education  programming  to
change the course of her entire future; and
  WHEREAS,  Brittany Roan may now stand with just pride in assessing her
achievements, experiencing the satisfaction of her labors and the joy of
her accomplishments, eager to face the challenge of new  ventures;  now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
commend Brittany Roan upon the occasion of being named  Student  of  the
Year by the New York Association for Continuing/Community Education; and
be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Brittany Roan.
